stories.storyDetails: As a user, I can view content based on my nearest location, so that I can browse deals closest to me.
stories.acceptanceCriteria:
Verify that the user’s location is automatically determined by IP lookup or HTML 5 Geo API and the closest store for my location is selected.

Demonstrate the user will return to the same store upon return visits.

Demonstrate that if the user manually selects a store, they’re brought back to that store when returning to the site.

Validate the store's location is displayed according to the design template for a SmartCircular 5 site.

	Show me a link to change location
stories.limits: Users can only be brought back to their manually-selected store location if cookies are enabled in their web browser.

stories.storyDetails: As a user, if my location cannot be determined by IP lookup services, I can input a zip code or city/state combination so I can browse deals based on my location of choice.
stories.acceptanceCriteria:
Demonstrate if my location cannot be determined by IP lookup or HTML5 Geo API, I am prompted to enter my zip code or city, state combination.

Demonstrate that if an invalid zip code or city, state combination is entered a user friendly error message is displayed.

Validate set focus, where the cursor is already flashing within the text box.

Verify upon submission, the user is brought to the closest store location based on submitted information.

stories.storyDetails: As a user, I can change my store location so I can view deals based on a location of my choice.
stories.acceptanceCriteria:
Verify the current store location is clearly displayed as per the design template for SmartCircular 5 site.

Demonstrate a user can click on change location as per the design template for SmartCircular 5 site.

Demonstrate a user can change location by entering a new zip code or city, state combination.

Verify that state abbreviations are recognized (ex: IL for Illinois)

Show me a successful entry of a zip code or city, state combination returns a list of the 10 closest stores within 100 miles of the location entered.

Verify the following display for each store:

	Street address

	Street address

	City, state and zip code

	Phone number (if applicable)

	Store hours

	Link to Make my Store

		Demonstrate that clicking on the Make my Store button will return the user to the first page of the ads available for that specific location

	Link to View in Map

		Demonstrate that clicking on the View in Map button will show the user the google maps available for the selected location.

Verify the following display for the user’s currently selected store:

	City, state and zip code

	Map view

Demonstrate that if an invalid zip code or city, state combination is entered a user friendly error message is displayed.

Demonstrate that if an invalid zip code or city, state combination is entered a user friendly error message is displayed.

Show me a way to leave the change store screen.

stories.storyDetails: As a user, I can view a header with a client logo, so I know this site is associated with the client brand.
stories.acceptanceCriteria:
Verify the logo, is displayed in the header and footer per the SmartCircular 5 design template

	 Verify that if more than 4 promotions are available, a View All selection is displayed

	Demonstrate that any additional promotions are accessed by clicking View all

Show me the following details for each promotion:

	Promotion title

	Promotion valid dates

	Promotion cover image

	Call-to-action for browsing

Verify clicking on the promotion’s title or image brings the user to page one of the selected promotion.

stories.storyDetails: As a marketer, I can link users to specific pages within the SmartCircular 5 site, so that I may drive traffic to specific content based on my goals.
stories.acceptanceCriteria:
Validate a user can deep link into the following content types, including a combination (when valid):

	Specific Store Locations

	Specific Promotion

	Specific Promotion Page

	Specific Item detail

	Specific Categories

Validate that upon following any deep link, a user will be shown content for their current store location, unless a specific location is defined within the deep link.

Demonstrate that if a user follows a deep link that is no longer valid, a user-friendly message is displayed stating that the content has expired.

	Show me a prompt to view the current content for their store. 

Show me a deep link can be tracked through WebTrends by appending AdRef=value.

	Client or third parties can use a unique label for the value in the AdRef to identify unique traffic.

	Tracking results from any inbound link with an AdRef tag will be available under the campaign report in WebTrends.
stories.limits: Should a URL use an AdRef tag that is not directing to a Shoplocal hosted property, the traffic will not be counted in the WebTrends reporting.

Validate all reporting is accessible through WebTrends analytics tools.

Verify all SmartCircular 5 data is captured in WebTrends in a unique profile.

The following reports will be available by platform (mobile, tablet, desktop):

	Activity per a specific time period

	Overall visits

	Return visits vs. new visitors

	Referrer

	Geographical information

	Action tracking 

	Circular interactions

	Campaign reporting
stories.limits: Webtrends is a 3rd party analytics provider; Shoplocal does not manage the Webtrends reporting interface
